result.execSummary:
The defendant Dolores Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $150.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Huber Privileges and Good Time credit granted.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dolores Rivera

Return to sender, unable to forward, not delivivearble as addressed.  se

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:21 PM: Defendant Dolores Rivera in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel today.  ADA offers resolution based upon plea today.  Def agrees to State's recital.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea Ct 1 DC w/o Weapon Enh:  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Weapon Enhancer dismissed by the Court.   Argument as to sentencing by ADA - argues for Probation with terms outlined for the Court.  Statement by Def:  Def refuses probation.  Court advises Def that this is a probation case.  Defendant does not want supervision for 12 mos.  ADA recommends 20-30 days WCJ in lieu of refusal of probation.  The Court:  Will honor Def's request and imposes 45 days WCJ w/GT and no TS credit; Report 11/1/2015 @ 8:00 PM, Court Costs plus DNA Surcharge - bond to be applied, 60 DTP Bal or PP; DNA sample to be provided today  Expungement process thru DOJ of her DNA record explained.   Appeal Rights Given.
